pages.text: Tired of farming monsters out in the world and wish you could just spawn them in the safety of your own home?$(br2)Soul Shards is a (relatively) simple mod to allow you to do just that!

pages.title: Soul Shard
pages.text: This is a Soul Shard, the core of the mod. These can be used to capture the souls of slain creatures.

pages.title: Crafting a Soul Shard
pages.text: This gemstone, an Amethyst, is the catalyst needed to create a Soul Shard.$(br2)Once you have crafted the following platform, just right click with the catalyst on the glowstone in the and it will all be converted into a single, unbound Soul Shard.
4x Blocks of Obsidian$(br)4x Blocks of Quartz $(br)1x Block of Glowstone

Once you have a Soul Shard you must bind it to a particular creature as a single soul shard can only contain the souls of one type of creature.$(br2)In order to bind a soul shard you must kill a creature with the Soul Shard in your offhand or your hotbar.$(br2)The more souls you have in your Soul Shard the higher tier it is.

Now that you have a bound Soul Shard you'll need a Soul Cage to place it in.$(br2)A Soul Cage, with an inserted Soul Shard, will act much like a creature spawner. The higher tier shard equipped, though, the quicker it is.
$(br)You'll need a few Corrupted Ingots to craft a Soul Cage$(br2)Thankfully these are easy enough to obtain. You'll just need some Corrupted Essence and some Vile Dust.

You might find the process of collecting souls to be a bit slow for your tastes.$(br2)Equipped with the Vile Sword you'll gain an additional soul for every creature you kill ... of the proper type, of course.

pages.title: Soul Stealer
pages.text: Still not fast enough? With this enchantment your weapon will gain an additional soul per kill ... $(o)per enchantment level.$()$(br2) $(br)Before you ask, yes, this $(o)does$() stack with the Vile Sword's innate effect.

Soul Shard Tiers$(br2)Tier 0:    1 soul$(br)Tier 1:   64 souls$(br)Tier 2:  128 souls$(br)Tier 3:  256 souls$(br)Tier 4:  512 souls$(br)Tier 5: 1024 souls$(br2)At Tier 3 a Soul Cage no longer requires your presence.$(br2)At Tier 4 a Soul Cage no longer requires darkness.$(br2)At Tier 5 a Soul Cage can be$(br)   controlled by redstone.
